key_title: Key to the species of Dampiera

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Goodeniaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Goodeniaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Goodeniaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla-lobes with dark grey medifixed or branched hairs outside
Corolla-lobes with rusty-yellow branched and/or simple hairs outside
Stems papillate, mostly less than 30 cm long, usually with branched hairs particularly on younger growth; corolla hairs mostly branched; flowers solitary or paired; Nunniong Plateau
Stems smooth, often more than 30 cm long, virtually glabrous; corolla hairs mostly medifixed; flowers usually solitary; Licola area
Leaves variously shaped, not crowded, margins entire or toothed, if revolute then not concealing lower surface, if upper surface glabrous then not glossy
Leaves linear to linear-oblong, often crowded, margins entire and tightly revolute so as to conceal lower surface, upper surface glabrous and glossy
Leaves sessile, if upper surface glabrescent then not scabrous at maturity; north- western Victoria
Leaves often petiolate, upper surface glabrescent and often scabrous at maturity; montane areas of eastern Victoria
Leaves linear to oblong, margins entire or toothed and often recurved or revolute; inflorescences 1–3 together, 3–9-flowered; corolla with an upper tomentum of whitish hairs outside
Leaves more or less ovate, margins entire and thickened; inflorescence solitary, 1–3- flowered; corolla with an upper tomentum of rusty hairs outside

Plant with an overall greenish appearance; 2 or more smaller leaves often clustered in axils; inflorescence with an indumentum of rusty and grey branched hairs; between the Little Desert and Bendigo area
Plant with an overall white or greyish appearance; leaves not clustered in axils; inflorescences with a dense indumentum of white and/or grey branched hairs; far north-west only
